messages.message:
Hi team,
I’m trying to upload a sample to build a project in my crafting sandbox, but it’s stuck at “Adding files” with 0% progress.
The file is getting uploaded to the correct location, but after that, it gets stuck. I don’t see any errors.
could someone please suggest how to resolve this ?
Crafting Sandbox : https://https--pramod1-instabase.instabase.site.sandboxes.run
Can you check the logs for celery-app-tasks to see whether digitization has started or not?
Or is celery-app-tasks up without any errors?

I see few errors in celery-app-tasks

```Error: Invalid value for '-A' / '--app': 
Unable to load celery application.
While trying to load the module instabase.registry.tasks the following error occurred:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/celery/app/utils.py", line 383, in find_app
    sym = symbol_by_name(app, imp=imp)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/kombu/utils/imports.py", line 64, in symbol_by_name
    return getattr(module, cls_name) if cls_name else module
AttributeError: module 'instabase.registry' has no attribute 'tasks'

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:```
```Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/celery/bin/celery.py", line 58, in convert
    return find_app(value)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/celery/app/utils.py", line 386, in find_app
    sym = imp(app)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/celery/utils/imports.py", line 109, in import_from_cwd
    return imp(module, package=package)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.9/importlib/__init__.py", line 127, in import_module
    return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level)
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1030, in _gcd_import
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1007, in _find_and_load
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 986, in _find_and_load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 680, in _load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap_external>", line 850, in exec_module
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 228, in _call_with_frames_removed
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/registry/tasks.py", line 35, in <module>
    from instabase.clients_factory_utils import clients_factory
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/clients_factory_utils/clients_factory.py", line 7, in <module>
    from instabase.flow_datastore.datastore import DataStore
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/flow_datastore/datastore.py", line 12, in <module>
    from instabase.content.filehandle import ibfile
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/content/filehandle/ibfile.py", line 21, in <module>
    from instabase.utils.rpc.file_client import (
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/utils/rpc/file_client.py", line 23, in <module>
    from instabase.utils.grpc.client import execute, execute_without_retries, _is_retriable_error
  File "/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/utils/grpc/client.py", line 17, in <module>
    from instabase.tracing.grpc import intercept_channel_tracing
ImportError: cannot import name 'intercept_channel_tracing' from 'instabase.tracing.grpc' (/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/tracing/grpc/__init__.py)```
Try running `cs stop celery-app-tasks` , navigate to the celery-app-tasks directory and run `make clean` . Then start celery-app-tasks again with `cs start celery-app-tasks` .

Thanks, the above error is resolved, but the file is still getting stuck. I think it’s stuck because digitization is not starting
Here are latest logs:

```[2025-07-04 12:23:56,129] [ForkPoolWorker-9/ThreadPoolExecutor-11_0] {/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/flow/ocr_utils/ocr_util.py:555} INFO - [trace_id=9e0183bec7884257] - job-id=c135a267-2aa5-4e09-b7fd-483cc427edfa task-id=c135a267-2aa5-4e09-b7fd-483cc427edfa-Stage1 username=pramod.developer_instabase.com (http://pramod.developer_instabase.com) stage-id=Stage1 step=s1 The mean is 3.3396280477326727 and the thresh was 3.0
[2025-07-04 12:23:56,831] [ForkPoolWorker-9/ThreadPoolExecutor-11_0] {/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/flow/ocr_utils/ocr_util.py:468} INFO - [trace_id=9e0183bec7884257] - job-id=c135a267-2aa5-4e09-b7fd-483cc427edfa task-id=c135a267-2aa5-4e09-b7fd-483cc427edfa-Stage1 username=pramod.developer_instabase.com (http://pramod.developer_instabase.com) stage-id=Stage1 step=s1 Page is de-warped successfully!!
[2025-07-04 12:23:56,832] [ForkPoolWorker-9/ThreadPoolExecutor-11_0] {/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/flow/ocr_utils/ocr_util.py:964} INFO - [trace_id=9e0183bec7884257] - job-id=c135a267-2aa5-4e09-b7fd-483cc427edfa task-id=c135a267-2aa5-4e09-b7fd-483cc427edfa-Stage1 username=pramod.developer_instabase.com (http://pramod.developer_instabase.com) stage-id=Stage1 step=s1 OCR request completed - Path=deb0736e-6961-4b5f-9db7-95e8c4a23703__8.jpg TimeTaken=2.73s
[2025-07-04 12:23:56,833] [ForkPoolWorker-9/ThreadPoolExecutor-11_0] {/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/flow/ocr_utils/ocr_util.py:990} INFO - [trace_id=9e0183bec7884257] - job-id=c135a267-2aa5-4e09-b7fd-483cc427edfa task-id=c135a267-2aa5-4e09-b7fd-483cc427edfa-Stage1 username=pramod.developer_instabase.com (http://pramod.developer_instabase.com) stage-id=Stage1 step=s1 Selected best rotation - Path=deb0736e-6961-4b5f-9db7-95e8c4a23703__8.jpg TimeTaken=0.00s
[2025-07-04 12:23:56,869] [ForkPoolWorker-9/ThreadPoolExecutor-12_0] {/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/flow/runnables/process_file/entity_util.py:219} INFO - [trace_id=9e0183bec7884257] - job-id=c135a267-2aa5-4e09-b7fd-483cc427edfa task-id=c135a267-2aa5-4e09-b7fd-483cc427edfa-Stage1 username=pramod.developer_instabase.com (http://pramod.developer_instabase.com) stage-id=Stage1 step=s1 Running Entity Inference: deb0736e-6961-4b5f-9db7-95e8c4a23703__8.jpg
[2025-07-04 12:23:56,871] [ForkPoolWorker-9/ThreadPoolExecutor-12_1] {/instabase/workers/celery-app-tasks/py/instabase/flow/runnables/process_file/entity_util.py:219} INFO - [trace_id=9e0183bec7884257] - job-id=c135a267-2aa5-4e09-b7fd-483cc427edfa task-id=c135a267-2aa5-4e09-b7fd-483cc427edfa-Stage1 username=pramod.developer_instabase.com (http://pramod.developer_instabase.com) stage-id=Stage1 step=s1 Running Entity Inference: deb0736e-6961-4b5f-9db7-95e8c4a23703__8.jpg```
No, it has started. This means its trying to download the required models in model-service to run entity inference, therefore, the request keeps waiting. The first time you run it, it takes sometime.
Or you can optionally turn entity inference off too if you're not testing anything specific to entity inference.

Okay, Thank you.
How long does it take the first time we run it?

@Pramod Munemanik, Model-Service still hasn't booted up properly for your sandbox. Wait for a few more minutes till it gets booted up properly. Digitization will be completed only after that. Even if you turned off the entity, indexing will fail.
Aah it stuck for more than 1 hour. Try restarting the model service.
Thanks.. Let me restart model service
